metadata.title: CVE-2020-14152 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In IJG JPEG (aka libjpeg) before 9d, jpeg_mem_available() in jmemnobs.c indjpeg does not honor the max_memory_to_use setting, possibly causingexcessive memory consumption.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14152` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjpeg62 - 1:6b2-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

libjpeg-turbo-progs - 1.4.2-0ubuntu3.4+esm1
libjpeg-turbo-test - 1.4.2-0ubuntu3.4+esm1
libjpeg-turbo8 - 1.4.2-0ubuntu3.4+esm1
libturbojpeg - 1.4.2-0ubuntu3.4+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libjpeg-progs - 1:9b-1ubuntu1+esm1
libjpeg9 - 1:9b-1ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libjpeg6b package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:6b2-2ubuntu0.1~esm1').
libjpeg-turbo package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.2-0ubuntu3.4+esm1').
libjpeg9 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9b-1ubuntu1+esm1').
